title: stopping scripting
body: is there a way to get the game itself to recognize when a script is being used then it simply kicks the player? it would be in the first min or so of the game and ends it straight away, plus naming the summoner who was cheating, "game ended, blahblah was cheating", the social backlash would be massive and immediate.

replies.body: The thing is riot dont like naming and shaming for some reason, i mean i think naming and shaming is fitting if someone is doing bad shit you know? riots take on it is ridiculous, there are reasons people want to name and shame others and they're like, "nah it'd hurt their feelings". its a silly mentality, id like to know who to dodge a game if i get into one and who not to.
i dont mind the dodgers so much, if they crying enough to dodge then i dont want to play with them anyway. The scripters are another story. I want to know who is cheating me out of a decent game.
I meant more for me to dodge as to not waste time playing a 20-40 game, more so than other people dodging.
Good idea, but that would mean Riot would have to check every player before every game with an integrated system. It's probably possible, and I hope they can decrease the number of scripting Vaynes.

I dont think they would need to check every player if the game recognized when scripting was happening. Regardless i found a scripting site and reported it to Riot last night.  They have their fraud team on it now.
